subject: Re: [junit] different results between swingui and textui runner
msgSnippet: Most likely some classloader related issue. The swingui uses a custom classloader to enable tests to be reloaded. Try turning off reloading or excluding
messageBody:
Most likely some classloader related issue. The swingui uses a custom
classloader to enable tests to be reloaded. Try turning off reloading or
excluding suspect classes from being reloaded.

- Neil


----- Original Message -----
From: "mjz115" <mikezawacki@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 2004 9:04 PM
Subject: [junit] different results between swingui and textui runner


> I've written a simple test case that successfully runs using the
> textui test runner. When I attempt to run the same exact test using
> the swingui or awtui test runner, I get a NullPointerException. Can
> anyone explain what might be different about the jvm, classloader, or
> environment when using the swingui.TestRunner? Unfortunately, my class
> is not the one spewing out the exception so I can't use source code to
> see what's going on.
>
> -Michael
